Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The graphs illustrate United States regional differences in household lighting consumption, percent of incandescent lightbulbs per household, and percent of households with <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> or more lightbulbs. All values are the difference from the United States average for that category. Regional Differences in Lighting Consumption Regional Differences in Lightbulb Usage (a) Based on the graphs, identify the region of the United States that uses the lowest percent of incandescent lightbulbs for residential lighting per household.

(b) Based on the graphs, identify the approximate difference in lighting consumption (in <math alttext="kilowatt hours" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>kWh</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) per household in the Middle Atlantic region from the United States average.

(c) Based on the graphs, identify the region of the United States where the use of incandescent lightbulbs is approximately <math alttext="44 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>44</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> per household.
(d) Explain how a household can reduce its energy consumption from lighting without changing the percent of incandescent lightbulbs or the total number of lightbulbs in the house.

In some regions of the United States, power companies have started to replace fossil fuels with renewable energy sources for electricity generation. In 2019, electricity generation by wind surpassed hydroelectric generation for the first time, and wind energy now contributes the largest amount of electricity generation by any renewable energy source in the United States. Geothermal energy is the renewable energy source that contributes the smallest amount of electricity generation in the United States.(e) Explain why a power company would choose wind energy rather than energy from biomass to replace electricity generation by fossil fuels.
(f) Describe one environmental problem associated with the renewable energy source that is the smallest contributor to electricity generation in the United States.
(g) Make a claim that proposes a reasonable solution to the problem identified in part (f).
(h) Describe a disadvantage or unintended consequence of the solution proposed in part (g).
